Description: Fragment of rim and floor of East Greek pottery plate. On rim, frieze of meander hooks. The outer floor has band of alternating rosettes and sets of tongues and the tondo probably a floral star of lotus and tongues; added red on the tongues and rosettes. Friezes are separated by band with added red line lined in white.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 221, no. 81)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 112, pl. XXXV, no. 323.2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.670)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5947 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
